title: Coca-Cola adj. EPS falls 2% to match consensus
text: Coca-Cola Co. shares KO, +0.56% rose 1.6% after a small beat in third-quarter revenue. The company did not provide net income numbers in its release, but said per-share earnings rose 37% to 60 cents. Adjusted EPS fell 2% to 56 cents, matching the FactSet consensus. Revenue rose 8% to $9.5 billion, ahead of the $9.4 billion FactSet consensus. The company said it now expects full-year EPS to range from a decline of 1% to growth of 1%, unchanged from previous guidance. Shares have gained 13.6% in 2019, underperforming the Dow Jones Industrial Average's DJIA, +0.09% gain of 16% and the S&P 500's SPX, +0.28% 20% gain.
